00001 /**
00002  * \file Planimeter.cpp
00003  * \brief Command line utility for measuring the area of geodesic polygons
00004  *
00005  * Copyright (c) Charles Karney (2010, 2011) <charles@karney.com> and licensed
00006  * under the MIT/X11 License.  For more information, see
00007  * http://geographiclib.sourceforge.net/
00008  *
00009  * Compile and link with
00010  *   g++ -g -O3 -I../include -I../man -o Planimeter \
00011  *       Planimeter.cpp \
00012  *       ../src/DMS.cpp \
00013  *       ../src/GeoCoords.cpp \
00014  *       ../src/Geodesic.cpp \
00015  *       ../src/GeodesicLine.cpp \
00016  *       ../src/MGRS.cpp \
00017  *       ../src/PolarStereographic.cpp \
00018  *       ../src/PolygonArea.cpp \
00019  *       ../src/TransverseMercator.cpp \
00020  *       ../src/UTMUPS.cpp
00021  *
00022  * See the <a href="Planimeter.1.html">man page</a> for usage
00023  * information.
00024  **********************************************************************/
00025 
00026 #include <iostream>
00027 #include <string>
00028 #include <sstream>
00029 #include <fstream>
00030 #include <GeographicLib/PolygonArea.hpp>
00031 #include <GeographicLib/DMS.hpp>
00032 #include <GeographicLib/Utility.hpp>
00033 #include <GeographicLib/GeoCoords.hpp>
00034 
00035 #include "Planimeter.usage"
00036 
00037 int main(int argc, char* argv[]) {
00038   try {
00039     using namespace GeographicLib;
00040     typedef Math::real real;
00041     real
00042       a = Constants::WGS84_a<real>(),
00043       f = Constants::WGS84_f<real>();
00044     bool reverse = false, sign = true, polyline = false;
00045     std::string istring, ifile, ofile;
00046 
00047     for (int m = 1; m < argc; ++m) {
00048       std::string arg(argv[m]);
00049       if (arg == "-r")
00050         reverse = !reverse;
00051       else if (arg == "-s")
00052         sign = !sign;
00053       else if (arg == "-l")
00054         polyline = !polyline;
00055       else if (arg == "-e") {
00056         if (m + 2 >= argc) return usage(1, true);
00057         try {
00058           a = Utility::num<real>(std::string(argv[m + 1]));
00059           f = Utility::fract<real>(std::string(argv[m + 2]));
00060         }
00061         catch (const std::exception& e) {
00062           std::cerr << "Error decoding arguments of -e: " << e.what() << "\n";
00063           return 1;
00064         }
00065         m += 2;
00066       } else if (arg == "--input-string") {
00067         if (++m == argc) return usage(1, true);
00068         istring = argv[m];
00069       } else if (arg == "--input-file") {
00070         if (++m == argc) return usage(1, true);
00071         ifile = argv[m];
00072       } else if (arg == "--output-file") {
00073         if (++m == argc) return usage(1, true);
00074         ofile = argv[m];
00075       } else if (arg == "--version") {
00076         std::cout
00077           << argv[0]
00078           << ": $Id: 9e86fcfa71ff796f3ac3b4395f565456f2ae86eb $\n"
00079           << "GeographicLib version " << GEOGRAPHICLIB_VERSION_STRING << "\n";
00080         return 0;
00081       } else
00082         return usage(!(arg == "-h" || arg == "--help"), arg != "--help");
00083     }
00084 
00085     if (!ifile.empty() && !istring.empty()) {
00086       std::cerr << "Cannot specify --input-string and --input-file together\n";
00087       return 1;
00088     }
00089     if (ifile == "-") ifile.clear();
00090     std::ifstream infile;
00091     std::istringstream instring;
00092     if (!ifile.empty()) {
00093       infile.open(ifile.c_str());
00094       if (!infile.is_open()) {
00095         std::cerr << "Cannot open " << ifile << " for reading\n";
00096         return 1;
00097       }
00098     } else if (!istring.empty()) {
00099       std::string::size_type m = 0;
00100       while (true) {
00101         m = istring.find(';', m);
00102         if (m == std::string::npos)
00103           break;
00104         istring[m] = '\n';
00105       }
00106       instring.str(istring);
00107     }
00108     std::istream* input = !ifile.empty() ? &infile :
00109       (!istring.empty() ? &instring : &std::cin);
00110 
00111     std::ofstream outfile;
00112     if (ofile == "-") ofile.clear();
00113     if (!ofile.empty()) {
00114       outfile.open(ofile.c_str());
00115       if (!outfile.is_open()) {
00116         std::cerr << "Cannot open " << ofile << " for writing\n";
00117         return 1;
00118       }
00119     }
00120     std::ostream* output = !ofile.empty() ? &outfile : &std::cout;
00121 
00122     const Geodesic geod(a, f);
00123     PolygonArea poly(geod, polyline);
00124     GeoCoords p;
00125 
00126     std::string s;
00127     real perimeter, area;
00128     unsigned num;
00129     while (std::getline(*input, s)) {
00130       bool endpoly = s.empty();
00131       if (!endpoly) {
00132         try {
00133           p.Reset(s);
00134           if (Math::isnan(p.Latitude()) || Math::isnan(p.Longitude()))
00135             endpoly = true;
00136         }
00137         catch (const GeographicErr&) {
00138           endpoly = true;
00139         }
00140       }
00141       if (endpoly) {
00142         num = poly.Compute(reverse, sign, perimeter, area);
00143         if (num > 0) {
00144           *output << num << " "
00145                   << Utility::str<real>(perimeter, 8);
00146           if (!polyline)
00147             *output << " " << Utility::str<real>(area, 3);
00148           *output << "\n";
00149         }
00150         poly.Clear();
00151       } else
00152         poly.AddPoint(p.Latitude(), p.Longitude());
00153     }
00154     num = poly.Compute(reverse, sign, perimeter, area);
00155     if (num > 0) {
00156       *output << num << " "
00157               << Utility::str<real>(perimeter, 8);
00158       if (!polyline)
00159         *output << " " << Utility::str<real>(area, 3);
00160       *output << "\n";
00161     }
00162     poly.Clear();
00163     return 0;
00164   }
00165   catch (const std::exception& e) {
00166     std::cerr << "Caught exception: " << e.what() << "\n";
00167     return 1;
00168   }
00169   catch (...) {
00170     std::cerr << "Caught unknown exception\n";
00171     return 1;
00172   }
00173 }
